name: Robin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2020
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Lee Anne is a fantastic host. She is friendly and attentive. Easy to communicate with at all times. She provided us with a breakfast starter kit of homemade banana bread, yogurt, bottled water, coffee, tea, creamer and sugar. She has great suggestions of fun places to go and local things to do. The cottage is a short walk to downtown and many local parks. It has everything you could want and then some. Comfortable for 2 adults, it is clean and cozy. We love the 2 parking spaces(one big enough to fit our one ton truck) and spacious locked and fenced back porch where we were able to store 4 bikes and still have space for grilling lounging and eating outside. Towels are fluffy , water pressure is strong, there is the cutest tub I have ever seen, bed is comfortable and the internet is fast and consistent. The washer and dryer work well and quickly! Recommend the vine st. cottage for a short or long stay in Albany.

Â·

Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Beautiful Cottage, close to everything. I stayed a month and a half and loved every minute of my stay. The Cottage was clean, bright and well stocked for any type of cooking (incuding spices). Towels and bedding was luxurious, including the snuggly handmade quilts that I used often on the leather couch. The appliances were large capacity and worked well, including the full sized washer and dryer downstairs. Julie & Mike provided every comfort needed to stay a day or a month. Including hand soap, dish & dishwasher soap, lots of dishes, glasses w/wine glasses, silverware, pots/pans/cookie sheet/ blender, coffee pot and a full Humming Bird feeder for your bird watching. They also provide picnic items for having your lunch under the Grape Arbor. Festive lights on a timer make the magic come alive in the evening. I would highly recommend J&M's cottage for a romantic get-away or family trip to Albany Oregon.

review_text:
We were visiting friends in Albany, Oregon and were looking at hotels for lodging. The only choices were close to highway 5 which is noisy and would have been kind of spartan and commercial. We decided to look at AirBnB and were pleasantly surprised at what we found. There were two places listed for Albany and the listing of Julie and Mike stood out over the other place for several reasons. First of all it was a better deal because of their more reasonable cleaning fee. The other was the charm of the cottage and the privacy that it provided. Because we were able to park beside the house in its own driveway it felt more like we were part of the neighborhood rather than intruders.
Instructions for accessing the key were straightforward and easy and when we walked in it was such a beautiful little cottage with a fully functional kitchen, lots of suggestions for local restaurants and eateries, activities, places to visit, etc. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Absolutely adorable house, beautifully maintained, and has all the little touches to make it a perfect home away from home for your visit to the Albany area. We were In town to tour OSU and we were very happy with the location. Easy hour drive from Portland, 15 minutes to get to the school, and a pretty scenic hour drive to the ocean for a day trip to Newport. Julie and Mike were very easy to communicate with and were great ambassadors of the town of Albany and of OSU as well. I Will definitely be staying here again when we are back in town. If I could give 6 stars across the board I would!

review_text: Our stay at this location was perfect. Our family stayed in town for a celebration of life and it was a great place to come back to and unwind. The house felt very comfortable, clean, and had everything we needed. All the beds were comfortable and the rooms were quite large. Perfect for a large group or family. We used the gas grill out back to cook some burgers and it was a nice area to relax and enjoy the weather. There were plenty of grocery stores nearby including a Costco as well as some great restaurants. Our favorites were Popâ€™s Branding Iron and Los Tequilas. The downtown shops were close however almost everything was closed on Sunday. We did get the chance to ride the carousel at the museum before it closed though. If we were to come back and visit, we would definitely stay here again!

name: Bea
rating_info:

,

,

Group trip
review_text:
Our group of nine women pushed the limits of the sleeping accommodationsâ€”especially since none of us wanted to share a bed. But we got by just fine. Several of us brought sleeping bags and pads. (All of us are members of an outdoor club so are accustomed to camping out.)
One gal set up her tent in the back yard, another slept in her portable reclining patio chair on the back deck. We used the cot provided at the house, and I brought an additional cot and pad for myself, which I set up in the Master bedroom.
Everyone loved the spaciousness and cleanliness of the house. The backyard and deck are lovely. Several people brought camp chairs to use outside (per my suggestion since there are only two chairs on the deck), and we found it very pleasant indeed, to sit outside.
There were so many choices of nice places to gather and visit and share snacks both inside and outside the house. At the same time the bedrooms upstairs provided quiet space for anyone who wanted to drop out and rest. It was ideal for our group.
We were very pleased to find that there are three bathrooms: A half bath downstairs in addition to the two full bathrooms on the second floor.
Several people chose to walk to and from the Hot Air Balloon Festival, rather than deal with the crowded parking lots near Timber Linn Park. Having the Festival venue within walking distance was a definite plus for us.
If we decide to do the Balloon Festival again next year, we will definitely want to rent Henkâ€™s house!

review_text:
Itâ€™s a (brand new & renovated) basement appartement, very nice decorated with two comfy king beds. Basically all is available, with a nice kitchen en bathroom. The house itself is about 100 years old and looks amazing. As itâ€™s a basement appartement the ceilings are rather low so be carefull :).
I give 3 stars for 2 main reasons; first of all because the upper house and the level of noise. We were very lucky that there were just two older guests staying upstairs instead of e.g. 6 people, but even then, itâ€™s very noisy and you can hear basically everything. Just to keep in mind. Second, suddenly the air conditioning downstairs started to blow strongly, and it seems thats connected/controlled by the upper house. This is something that really should be divided in one way or another. Further, and just a note, and not sure if that was mentioned in the info, they ask for a parking fee for the big driveway, or else, ask you to park 15 feet away (which is free). Itâ€™s not about the money itself, but why ask for a fee and donâ€™t offer that as a service as there is plenty of space, both on the driveway and on the street.
If the upper house is empty, I would go again, if not, I would hesitate.

Fantastic place to stay! I spent a month here and loved it. The hosts are a super nice young couple with two adorable kids.
The rental is in their backyard, close to their house, but you never hear a thing from them! The whole setup is very private, including your own separate parking space. A motion detector turns on lights for you as you head down the path from your car to the cottage.
Perfect for safety conscious solo travelers, nice and secure. Safe privacy.
This is between Albany and Corvallis, but closer to Corvallis. Less than ten minutes to downtown, less than 15 to campus. Easy access to go to games or other OSU events.
The kitchen is very well supplied. I loved the frother on the Keurig, had never used one of those, made lattes most days, and they provide a huge spice rack loaded with flavors. The kitchen is def complete.
Bed is comfortable and, again, nice and quiet.
The shower/bathroom is very nice, as well. They did a great job with the remodel.
And oh yeah, the front porch! Loved it. Great place to sit and chill in your private space. Yes, this is a nice setup.
Would absolutely stay here again, probably will!

review_text:
Heather is amazing. The experience was so good, Iâ€™m not sure where to start.
I stayed at the guesthouse with my girlfriend for about a month. I had never stayed at an Airbnb that long so I was a bit nervous, but all that disappeared once we met her and stepped foot in the place. It was stylish, clean (like whoa), and the most of all well thought out. Privacy? Check. Kitchen with a range? Check. Washer & dryer? Check. I mean it was like living in a fully furnished tiny home with all the amenities we could think of. Heather asked us even before we arrived, if thereâ€™s anything weâ€™d like set up. She followed up several times making sure our stay was comfortable, always letting us know ahead of time when things might become noisy (yard work etc). It never became that loud, but we appreciated the excellent communication.
The bonus for us was the view. The front porch faces a very large open field, and weâ€™d frequently see neighboring cows hang out, grazing on the grass. They were super friendly and curious. Having lived most of my life in the cities, the countryside was so refreshing that I often sat there with a cup of tea just looking out. And even though the guesthouse is located close to the nature, it is only 10 minutes away from a vibrant college town with local restaurants, shopping, etc.
If youâ€™re interested in experiencing peace and quiet while having access to cities, this is THE place. We canâ€™t recommended it enough!

review_text: This house was perfect for us! And Heather was the perfect host! My wife and I stayed here for two weeks so that we could quarantine before visiting my mother (who is immunocompromised) for Christmas. Heather contacted us before our stay to make sure the place was stocked with everything we'd need, even asking us what kinds of K-cups and shower toiletries we prefer. She bought a spice rack so that we would have spices to cook with. When we arrived, we were surprised and deeply touched by the holiday decorations they put up for us, including a Christmas tree on the porch, lights, a wreath, and two stockings with our names on them. This definitely put us in the Christmas spirit! We felt so welcome here. Everything inside also reflected Heather's personal touch, from holiday mugs to popcorn and snacks for us. The decor is modern yet warm. All of the appliances are up-to-date and worked great. The wifi was strong enough for my wife and I to have simultaneous Zoom work meetings. We enjoyed watching Netflix on the large TV. We could not have asked for a better place to stay these two weeks and we consider ourselves so lucky to have found the Stay at the Riverside Guesthouse. We are very grateful for their generosity and hospitality! Very highly recommended!

The kitchen was well stalked with what we needed to make beautiful meals to share together. We also enjoyed a cozy fire and great conversation in the living room. Beds were all very comfortable and each rooms was well appointed. There was also ample parking. We will definitely stay with Joyce again when we return to Albany.

review_text: I have been using Airbnb as a guest for several years, all over the world, and I have never experienced such generous hospitality as we felt this past week at Joyce's gorgeous home. Sadly, the reason for our trip was the heartbreaking funeral of a dear family member. So Joyce, knowing this, went grocery shopping for us, so that when we arrived the kitchen was stocked with granola, fruit, chocolates, snacks, and coffee, etc. It was such a touching gesture, we were all very grateful. The house is so lovely, the living room is so cozy with the wood burning stove and comfy sofas. The kitchen is exceptionally well stocked. The bedrooms are beautiful, and the beds so comfy. On the morning of the funeral, we woke up to snow, so stepping out onto that fabulous front porch to see the small canal out front of the house, under snow covered trees, with the little ducks happily swimming... well, it just seemed like something out of a fairy tale. We are super grateful for Joyce's kindness.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
An old home in a quiet, old neighbourhood. When you climb the eight steps to the front door, you are subjected to a pile of the neighbor's junk immediately to your left. Ugh.
Fortunately, while sitting on the rocking chairs or the swing chair on the front porch, the junk pile is not visible.
We slept well in the room with a king size bed. Each bedroom has it's own air conditioner. It's a quiet area at night. Close enough to downtown to easily walk there.
The interior of the main living space is dark, walls are painted in dark blue with dark wood trim and wood floors. However, there are two large windows which add light.
The squeaky wood floors throughout the house are either quaint or annoying. And the mish-mash of eating utensils in the kitchen, all of poor quality, need to be upgraded.
If you have not read the section in the listing described as "hosted by Joyce" be sure to do so. It is there you will find that there is a person living in the home. Sera lives downstairs, described as an "attached apartment". We met her twice in our five night stay, she was very friendly. In fact, she was helpful in resolving a nuisance light on the exterior of the house, next to the bedroom window, which comes on at dusk and off at dawn. A very bright light which made sleep difficult. Sera and Joyce were unable to turn off the light. But Sera did adjust the setting to turn on with motion sensor.
The home is listed as "waterfront". There is a small, concrete canal in front of the house, about eight feet wide and a foot deep. I don't call that waterfront.

The front porch was the perfect spot to have our morning coffee/tea or just relax in the evening. The stream across the street was soothing and was perfect to add to the serenity. We met a few neighbors who were so friendly!
Overall our stay was perfect and I'd highly recommend the home. Joyce was a pleasure to work with as well, very communicative!

We were there for my daughter's OSU graduation and needed to make a special dinner for the family for this special event. Lori went out of her way to make sure we had all the dishes and cooking equipment needed to make a beautiful meal.
When you stay, there will be sheets and a couple of blow up beds for the kids along with enough towels and dishware to fee the family. I'd stay with Lori anytime I come to Corvallis!

I adore this guest house and the family who owns it and lives next door. It is a great, peaceful, and slow paced neighborhood in walking distance to the old downtown and river.
If you are sensitive to noise, like me, you may want a noise machine overnight because the train horns can be heard from a couple miles away.
I chose Loriâ€™s place by chance, and then discovered after arrival that her family has known my in laws in town for 60 years. I was able to reintroduce them and it was a hoot! Discovered in the process that they are fellow people of faith. ;)
One the the appliances had a minor glitch, but Lori already had instructions and back-up appliances on hand. She was immediately responsive and offered to go to great lengths to repair the main appliance. We kept in touch and it was repaired at a convenient time.
I would love to stay here again! Thank you Lori and family!

review_text: An outstanding stay at a wonderful little place. The carriage house is nice and light with windows throughout, and linen privacy sheers which I really liked, as well as blackout curtains upstairs to accommodate various sleep preferences. Upstairs is a small bath with shower, washer and dryer, and large light room with queen bed. Air mattresses accommodate additional guests if needed. Downstairs is a cozy living room with furnace, small table, breakfast bar, and nicely-supplied kitchen. There's a small private backyard/patio which I hope to enjoy in better weather. Would definitely stay again in this quiet neighborhood and super nice space.

review_text: This was a lovely find. Melanie was extremely communicative and provided all of the necessary instructions. Clean up/check out was easy (she asks that used towels go in the bathtub, that the trash is taken out/liners replaced, dishwasher is started). The kitchen had everything we needed and more; bathroom also was well-stocked. Home was super cute and very clean. Items were labeled and easy to find. Shared laundry (via a locked door) with the other unit; those tenants were quiet but also very nice when I left them a note with a â€œwill we disturb you if we run a load of laundry later tonightâ€ messageâ€¦much appreciated their kind response. All in all: easy to find, clean, very cute, comfortable, safe and clean neighborhood. Note that the house does front what seemed like it may be a busy neighborhood road but it was quiet and I didnâ€™t notice traffic at all! I would recommend this home and this host without reservation. Thank you!

The location is quite convenient to commute to Corvallis. Albany and Corvallis have quite a bit to offer. I had very good eating and shopping experiences in both towns.
Oregon is cold for me, but the main heating unit is heating well. And there's a few small space heaters, & plenty of throws around the house.
All the bedding are warm and comfortable.
I had good nights' sleep.
Kitchen has enough pots, pans & utensils (also a small rice cooker) to do a simple full meal. I was able to cook my son his favorite pork ribs.
I think there was a mistake on the instruction inside the house on the laundry room. Melanie was VERY quick to respond. But I totally forgot to tell her what was on the instruction in the folder. Everything worked out in the end :)
I really like the local for the quiet and very home like feel. It certainly was a very good comfortable relaxing feeling whenever I get back to the house after a day's out.
I would be back when I'm going to Albany again.

January 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Home was sparkling clean and stocked with plenty of towels and extra linens for the cold. There is no shortage of blankets! The beds were so comfortable and there are plenty of pillows. The heater "Berta" is in the heart of the living room. Her ability to warm the home should not be underestimated- she will keep the house and the other rooms warm against the cold. The water heater is enough for multiple short showers, but not advised for baths. We loved that there were plenty of amenities in the kitchen, like the keurig and baking pans which we used for breakfast. The wifi is good enough to support a gamer, a student, and a researcher using it at the same time, given nobody is downloading a massive game. Overall, my family and I enjoyed a wonderful day to rest, do online work, and relax here in between driving.

Stayed about a week
review_text:
This was my fourth stay in five months at Talbert House, and this time my husband joined me. We were very comfortable, and he felt right at home as much as I did. It was rainy and cold the entire week, but we were warm and cozy in the cottage.
We cooked more than I had done on past trips, as we had driven and had room to bring more than when I had flown. We found Melinda's kitchen had everything we needed, along with extras - Melinda even left a gift for us!
Melinda is a perfect host. She communicates warmly and promptly, but gives us our space as well. Truly a wonderful rental.

name: Nancy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2023
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Because of a family emergency, I needed to come several days early for an already scheduled trip. Melinda responded quickly to my message and accommodated my additional dates. The cottage was a refuge after exhausting and stressful days. Also, Melinda had had the heating unit serviced since my last trip and it worked well. I used the office for a number of video meetings, and the internet was great. The well-equipped kitchen was great. Also, the lighting is terrific, with can lights in the living room, kitchen and bathrooms and lamps throughout the house. I used the washer/dryer for the first time, and it worked well (Melinda even provides detergent).
Throughout my stay, Melinda responded to any questions promptly, and checked in to see how I was doing from time to time. I can't recommend her cottage enough.

I was very grateful to have a washer and dryer for my weekâ€™s stay. The living room was very cozy and warm and so nice to curl up with a good movie at night. The location was easy to find, and my big SUV fit perfectly in the assigned parking spot. The highlight was the tokens Melinda left for me to take my niece on the Merry Goâ€™Round for special memories at Thanksgiving. I would definitely recommend and will be back! Thanks again for your generous hospitality!

name: Nancy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2023
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
I enjoyed my second week-long stay at Talbert House. In addition to what I wrote before, I'll mention that the bed is very comfortable and the bathrooms are remodeled nicely (as is the entire cottage). Melinda provides shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the two showers, as well as plenty of paper products. The kitchen appliances all work well. Everything is very clean. I learned that there is a wall heater in the main bathroom that warms the area. The main heating/cooling unit in the living room tries hard to heat the house, but the weather was cold during this stay (below freezing outside), and it had some trouble keeping up. But I was fine wrapping up in the plentiful throws and blankets.
Melinda is an excellent host, and communicates quickly and warmly. She provides all sorts of extra touches that make the cottage seem like a home away from home, and I very much enjoyed my stay. I look forward to my next stay in November.

name: Nancy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2023
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
I can't say enough good things about Talbert House. Melinda has remodeled this 1922 cottage with all the modern conveniences. It is spotlessly clean. The furniture is comfortable and attractive. The kitchen is well equipped, including three kinds of coffee makers (and provided coffee and teas). She could be a designer, with all the little touches throughout the house that were beautiful and functional. The TV worked well, with streaming capabilities.
She asks that shoes not be worn in the bedroom, so I'll bring slippers next time. The neighborhood is a few blocks further east from downtown than the airbnb map shows, but I felt safe. I found it easy to park on the street in front of the house, although there is a narrow driveway. A heater/air-conditioner mounted on the wall of the living room provided adequate heat, and Melinda provided many throws and extra blankets if needed. She also has books and games available.
This was a perfect haven. I already have two more trips booked!

review_text:
Our stay at Melindaâ€™s house was wonderful! The home is very welcoming, comfortable and nicely decorated. The kitchen is beautiful and fully stocked; you can cook or bake as much as you desire. Also, a lovely bottle of Oregon vino was set out for us to enjoy (thank you, Melinda!)
We also took advantage of the large, private backyard and enjoyed our morning coffee on the patio each day.
The house is located in the historic district of town and is within walking distance to many shops and restaurants, which is very convenient. The only (mild) downside is the street in front of the house. Itâ€™s a busy street and can be a little loud at times. Overall, it was an exceptional stay. We would definitely come back!
